sentences.en: " Not even dishonesty can tarnish the shine of profit. "
sentences.cn: 教条 181-即使是不名誉也不能损伤利润的光辉.
空气和潮湿使银子失去光泽.

sentences.en: Check cutlery cleanliness, free from tarnish and stained.
sentences.cn: 检查餐具的清洁, 保证光亮无污渍.

sentences.en: Edmond, my friend, do not tarnish that noble and pure image the mirror of my heart.
sentences.cn: 爱德蒙, 我的朋友, 不要打碎我心里时刻保持着的那个高贵而又美好的形象.

sentences.en: Fully - velvet - lined Wooden Jewelry Box ( Hand - painted with N . C . painting ground, solid color finish and anti - tarnish lining ).
sentences.cn: 全天鹅绒里料的木制首饰盒 ( 手绘普通油漆底色 、 素色、 抗 金银首饰变黑里料 ).

sentences.en: His regime was tarnished by human rights abuses.
sentences.cn: 他的政权因践踏人权而形象受损。

sentences.en: In natural environment, tarnish was observed on the surface of a commemoration silver coin of China.
sentences.cn: 银纪念币在大气环境中表面发生变色,失去原有的金属光泽.

sentences.en: Moisture leads to the tarnish of the silverware.
sentences.cn: 湿气使得银器毫无光泽.

sentences.en: People often buy stainless steel silverware because it tarnish easily.
sentences.cn: 人们常买不锈钢器皿,因为它不易变黑.

sentences.en: Polished aluminium will tarnish quickly and is often sprayed with a clear lacquer seal.
sentences.cn: 抛光过的铝很快就会被损毁并且常常要喷透明的密封漆.

sentences.en: Safely and effectively erases heat marks , removes tarnish , rust and corrosion from unlacquered metal surfaces.
sentences.cn: 安全有效地消除烧焦痕迹,擦除未上漆金属表面上的灰暗色 、 锈迹和腐蚀.
不锈钢产品不会失去光泽.

sentences.en: The affair could tarnish the reputation of the prime minister.
sentences.cn: 这一事件可能有损首相的名誉。

sentences.en: The tarnish lay thick on the inside of the ring.
sentences.cn: 戒指内侧有一层厚厚的锈斑。

sentences.en: These pessimistic predictions and doubts, however, cannot tarnish facts.
sentences.cn: 但预测也好、疑问也罢, 终究抵挡不住事实的光芒.

sentences.en: Wear cotton gloves when cleaning silver, because the acid in your skin can tarnish the metal.
sentences.cn: 清洁银器时要戴上棉手套，因为你皮肤里的酸性物质会使它失去光泽。

words.tran_cn: 玷污；使……失去光泽；使……变灰暗

trans.tran_en: dullness of colour, or loss of brightness
if metals such as silver,  copper  , or  brass  tarnish, or if something tarnishes them, they become dull and lose their colour

trans.tran_cn: （通常指金属）（使）失去光泽，（使）变灰暗
(尤指金属表面)失去光泽；玷污
trans.tran_en: if an event or fact tarnishes someone’s  reputation  , record, image etc, it makes it worse
